question: Will Leicester City vs. Tottenham Hotspur end in a draw?
description:
This market refers to the EPL match between Leicester City and Tottenham Hotspur scheduled for August 19, 2024, 7:00 PM ET.

If the match ends in a draw, this market will resolve to “Yes.” Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

If the game is canceled or delayed beyond August 26, 2024, this market will resolve to “Yes.”

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the English Premier League.

events.title: EPL: Leicester City vs. Tottenham Hotspur
events.description: EPL: Leicester City vs. Tottenham Hotspur

question: Mass arrests at DNC?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if 100 or more individuals are arrested in Chicago, protesting the 2024 Democratic National Convention between August 19, 12:00 AM ET, and August 22, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Biden say "Resign" at DNC speech?
description:
Joe Biden is scheduled to speak at the DNC Monday August 19.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Biden says "resign" during his main DNC speech. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If Biden does not give a speech at the DNC this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count (e.g. "resignation" will not count).

Compound words will count as long as "resign" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the voluntary leaving of a job.

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

question: Protestor invades stage at DNC?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if any unauthorized protestor enters the main stage during a speech or performance at the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Only invasions of the main stage at the United Center during the DNC counts toward this market's resolution. If another stage is invaded at the DNC, it will not count toward this market's resolution.

The primary resolution source for this market is video footage from the DNC.

question: Will Biden get a name wrong during DNC speech?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Joe Biden calls someone by an incorrect name or references the wrong person at any point during his main keynote speech during the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Biden will be considered to have gotten a name wrong if he addresses or refers to an individual using a name that is not their correct or commonly known name. This includes, but is not limited to, using a wrong first or last name, a nickname which is not associated with the person, or any mispronunciation that significantly alters the intended name (e.g. when Biden referred to Rishi Sunak as ‘Mr. Sanook’ this would qualify for a “Yes” see:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qm9IjiwJxAo).

If Biden says a person's name correctly but associates it with incorrect events or a different identity, this will also be sufficient to resolve the market to "Yes" (e.g. Biden says Andrew Tate is the current President of France).

If Biden corrects himself after using an incorrect name, it will still qualify for a "Yes" resolution. However, if Biden begins correcting the name before he has completed saying the incorrect name, and completes a full pronunciation correctly, it will not count toward the resolution of this market.

If Biden does not give a keynote speech before the end of the DNC, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video footage of the speech.

If Biden says a person's name correctly but associates it with incorrect events or a different identity, this will also be sufficient to resolve the market to "Yes" (e.g. Biden says Andrew Tate is the current President of France).

However, if Biden begins correcting the name before he has completed saying the incorrect name, and completes a full pronunciation correctly, it will not count toward the resolution of this market.

If Biden does not give a keynote speech before the end of the DNC, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video footage of the speech.

question: Will Jannik Sinner win the US Open?
description:
The market will resolve to “Yes” if Jannik Sinner wins the 2024 US Open Men’s Singles tournament. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

If at any point it becomes impossible for this player to win the US Open Men’s Singles Tournament per the rules of the US Open, this market will resolve to “No”.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the US Open (https://www.usopen.org), however credible reporting may also be used.

events.title: US Open Winner (M)

question: X banned in EU before October?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if use of X/Twitter is banned within EU member states for the majority of EU member state citizens between August 18 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Banned" is defined as EU citizens are officially barred from downloading and/or viewing X/Twitter, and/or posting on X/Twitter.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the European Union and X/Twitter, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

events.title: X banned in EU before October?
events.description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if use of X/Twitter is banned within EU member states for the majority of EU member state citizens between August 18 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Banned" is defined as EU citizens are officially barred from downloading and/or viewing X/Twitter, and/or posting on X/Twitter.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the European Union and X/Twitter, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Hillary Clinton say "Convicted felon" at DNC speech?
description:
Hillary Clinton is scheduled to speak at the DNC Monday August 19.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Clinton says "convicted felon" during his main DNC speech. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If Clinton does not give a speech at the DNC this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

question: Annual inflation above 2.5% in August?
description:
This is a market about inflation over the 12 month period ending August 2024 before seasonal adjustment as reported by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by more than 2.5 percent over the 12 month period ending August 2024 and “No“ otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS August 2024 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled to be released on September 11, 2024, at 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data.

----

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note: the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports inflation over 12 month periods to only one decimal point (e.g. 2.9%). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if inflation over the 12 month period ending in August before seasonal adjustment is 2.6%, this market will resolve to “Yes”, if it is 2.5%, this market will resolve to “No”).

question: France loses visa-free access to any African nation in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if any African country, where French citizens could enter without a visa as of August 19, 2024, announces they are introducing or have introduced a visa requirement for French citizens by December 31, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from relevant governments, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Taylor Swift sue Trump over fake endorsement?
description:
On August 18, 2024, Donald Trump shared AI-generated images on social media falsely depicting Taylor Swift and her fans endorsing him (see: https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/112984762512136574).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Taylor Swift files a lawsuit against Donald Trump or his campaign for using AI-generated images that imply her endorsement of Trump by 11:59 PM ET on August 31, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the involved parties and/or court filings, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Trump nominates Elon Musk to Cabinet?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump wins the 2024 election and nominates Elon Musk for a Cabinet position by January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will immediately resolve to "No" if Donald Trump loses the 2024 US Presidential Election.

A Cabinet position is defined as any of the heads of the 15 executive departments or a role formally designated as Cabinet-level by the President. Advisory roles will not qualify for this market. 

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Biden DNC Speech: O/U 30 minutes?
description:
This market will resolve to "Over" if Joe Biden's speech on the first night of the Democratic National Convention (DNC), exceeds 30 minutes in length. If the speech is 30 minutes or less, the market will resolve to "Under." 

The speech length will be measured from the start of when Biden begins audibly speaking on stage during his speech until he finishes his speech.

If Biden does not give a speech on the first night of the convention, this market will resolve to "Under".  

The resolution source will be the live video of the event.
